articles.title: OpenAI and Barbie-maker Mattel team up to bring generative AI to toy-making, other products
articles.description: Barbie-maker Mattel and OpenAI have teamed up to bring generative AI to the toy-making and ever-expanding pipeline of IP repackaging.
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan

articles.title: Conveyor uses AI to automate the painful process of vendor security reviews and RFPs with AI
articles.description: Conveyor claims that its AI agent can fill out over 90% of customer security questions fully, autonomously, and accurately, saving customers many hours and accelerating their sales process. The 4-year-old startup nabbed a $20 million Series B from SignalFire.
articles.author: Marina Temkin

articles.title: How Warp is introducing robots to automate its network of warehouses
articles.description: Warp can't automate long-haul trucking or short-range delivery, so it's working on what it can potentially change: the workflows inside its warehouses.
articles.author: Rebecca Szkutak

articles.title: Meta sues AI ‘nudify’ app Crush AI for advertising on its platforms
articles.description: Meta has sued the maker of a popular AI "nudify" app, Crush AI, that reportedly ran thousands of ads across its platforms.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff

articles.title: Multiverse Computing raises $215M for tech that could radically lower AI costs
articles.description: Spanish startup Multiverse Computing said it raised an enormous Series B round on the strength of a technology it calls “CompactifAI.”
articles.author: Julie Bort

articles.title: Apple is salvaging Image Playground with a boost from ChatGPT
articles.description: With the new ChatGPT integration, users will be able to access more styles that move beyond the emoji-like creations that Image Playground has become known for.
articles.author: Aisha Malik

articles.title: Sam Altman-backed Coco Robotics raises $80M
articles.description: Coco Robotics has made more than 500,000 deliveries with its zero-emissions robots since they hit the streets in 2020.
articles.author: Rebecca Szkutak

articles.title: Can Scale AI and Alexandr Wang reignite Meta’s AI efforts?
articles.description: Meta has reportedly invested billions of dollars into AI startup Scale AI and hired its CEO, Alexandr Wang, to lead a new AI research lab. So what does that mean for Meta and the rest of the AI ecosystem?
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff

articles.title: US government’s vaccine website defaced with AI-generated content
articles.description: The content of a vaccines information website owned by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services was swapped with gay-themed spam.
articles.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai

articles.title: At WWDC, Apple says it will use AI to tag apps to improve discoverability on the App Store
articles.description: Apple will begin using AI technology to power the discovery of apps on the App Store, the company announced at this week’s Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC 25). In a session focused on updates to App Store Connect, its app distribution platform for developers, the company announced it will introduce App Store Tags — labels that […]
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Wikipedia pauses AI-generated summaries pilot after editors protest
articles.description: Editors almost immediately criticized the pilot, raising concerns that it could damage Wikipedia's credibility.
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers

articles.title: Disney and Universal sue Midjourney, alleging AI-related copyright infringement
articles.description: The studios are seeking monetary damages, a jury trial, and an order barring Midjourney from further copyright infringement.
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers

articles.title: ChatGPT will avoid being shut down in some life-threatening scenarios, former OpenAI researcher claims
articles.description: Former OpenAI research leader Steven Adler published a new independent study that claims that, in certain scenarios, OpenAI's AI models will go to great lengths to try to avoid being shut down.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff

articles.title: Meta’s V-JEPA 2 model teaches AI to understand its surroundings
articles.description: Meta's V-JEPA 2 model is a "world model," referring to AI that is designed to understand its physical surroundings.
articles.author: Amanda Silberling

articles.title: Apple executives say new AI-powered Siri wasn’t ‘demoware’ — it just wasn’t ready to ship
articles.description: Apple senior vice president of software engineering Craig Federighi stressed that AI was a new technology, and something Apple sees more as a "long-term transformational wave" that will impact the industry and society for decades to come.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Pinterest tests an AI feature that lets advertisers turn their catalogs into shoppable collages
articles.description: Pinterest is experimenting with "auto-collages," an AI feature that allows advertisers to quickly turn their product catalogs into shoppable collages.
articles.author: Aisha Malik

articles.title: The Browser Company launches its AI-first browser, Dia, in beta
articles.description: With its built-in AI interface, Dia hopes to give people an easy way to use AI, cutting out the need to visit tools like  ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Claude.
articles.author: Ivan Mehta

articles.title: Uptime Industries wants to boost localized AI usage with an ‘AI-in-a-box’ called Lemony AI
articles.description: The Lemony AI device can run large language models, AI agents and automated workflows locally.
articles.author: Rebecca Szkutak

articles.title: Sam Altman thinks AI will have ‘novel insights’ next year
articles.description: OpenAI's CEO believes that AI systems will be capable of figuring out "novel insights" in 2026, he said in a blog post.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff

articles.title: OpenAI’s open model is delayed
articles.description: OpenAI was targeting an early summer release date for its open model, which is slated to have similar "reasoning" capabilities to OpenAI's o-series of models.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
